title.narrative: 2.5 COMMUNICATIONS, ADVOCACY&PARTNERSHIP

description.narrative: 2.5 UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnership on child rights issues with stakeholders, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Early Childhood Development, Environmental Sustainability, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.5 UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnership on child rightsissues with stakeholders

description.narrative: Huge achievements were recorded in the areas of media engagement, with an average of 70 key engagements per year in the last 3 years, leading to unprecedented positioning of women, children, and young people in public domain. High;calibre;content spanning from video, posters, animations, creative and engaging social media;content was;created, nearly 80 pieces of content including content on COVID 19. This content saw UNICEF reach more than 8 million people across different platforms.;Strategic media partnerships enabled community outreach and engagement on key behavioral issues and social norms of national proportions- that is over 50 million reached.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:25/01/2021
